heisig_story: The full kanji for the drum adds a branch, apparently to serve as a drumstick, to the primitive for drum.
koohiiStory1: Japanese festivals have drums so big, a samurai has to SIT (not stand) on a table to beat one with a tree branch! http://www.d2.dion.ne.jp/~hidafyh/furukawayh/gyouji/image/maturi03.jpg.
koohiiStory2: I really hate the primitive meaning of "table" for "bean." I just use "bean." Anyways, for the DRUM primitive, imagine a SAMURAI who beats on a DRUM with two chopsticks, and a BEAN skewered on each end of the chopstick to produce a better sound. And the obvious story is: "DRUMing on a DRUM with a huge BRANCH".

WaniKani_Meaning_Info: A branch is just like a drumstick, so of course you're going to drum them together.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Who loves to drum things together and make a huge racket? å­s (ã“), of course.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Kids can't get enough of it. Anything that makes a loud drumming noise or anything they can beat together is fun for them.

Oracle from " Zhu " (like a drum) from " and " (like a hand) from " rafter ", " serrata " of pictographic beginning of the text, will be holding a drumstick drum percussion meaning, the original meaning is drumming. The inscriptions may not be from the pictograms of "æ¡´" and "æ¹" but from "æ”´", all like drumsticks. After the Spring and Autumn Period, " Kou " may be added as a decorative pen. On this basis, the " Kou " in "Suowen" changed its shape to " ancient " sound.

Oracle is used as place name, "Collection" 36527: "Cai (Zai) Drum". Also used as a person's name and sacrifice name.

Bronze inscriptions are used as verbs to indicate beating. Wang Sun's survivor's bell: "The grandson of the grandson of the world will keep the drum forever." It means to keep the bell forever so that it can be played for a long time. It is also used as a noun to mean a musical instrument. Huanzi Mengjiang Kettle: "Drum Bell (bell) and one éŠ‰ (å››)", which means a set of bells and drums. Shushi Bell: "Bei (for example) if a bell (bell) drum" means that it looks like a bell and a drum. "poetry. Zhou Song. "Executive Competition": "The bell and the drum are loud, and the chime is the general." Yun Zhong: "The big bell (bell) is the county, and the jade [Jin Xiao] is the drum." [Jin Xiao] is under the guise of "æ¯Š", "Er Ya . "Shi Le": "The Great Chime is called the æ¯Š." It means that the big clock has been hung, and there are drums made of jade chimes and crocodile skins.

The bamboo slips of the Warring States Period were used as the original meaning to indicate drumming. "Rong Chengshi" Jane 48: "Three drums to advance, three drums to retreat."

Ancient drums are often used in wars to command the advance and retreat of the army, as well as for banquets and sacrifices. The verb " drum " not only means to beat the drum, but also to beat other percussion instruments. The drums are loud and majestic, and beating the big drum can increase courage. Therefore, with the language of "inspiration", the way of slapping the belly and feeling satisfied with life can be described as "puffing" (Shirakawa Jing). According to ancient times, the appearance of a belly bulging like a drum after eating is described as "puffing". The meaning of courage may also be derived from full of righteousness.

drum
Basic explanation of words
drum
gÇ”
Percussion instrument, cylindrical, hollow, with two skins: drum music (yu?). Drum horn (ji åƒ¶). Bass drum.
Shape, sound, and function like a drum: ear drum. Shigu.
Percussion or flapping to make a sound: preaching. Uproar.
Initiate, cheer up: encourage. Agitate. Inspire. All in one go.
High and protruding: bulge. Bulging.
In ancient times, drums were beaten at night to tell the time.

drum
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[â‘ ] [gÇ”]
["Guangyun" public account cut, grandma, see you. ]
Also known as "Drum 1". Also known as "é¼”1".
(1) Percussion instruments. They are mostly barrel-shaped or oblate, with a hollow in the middle, and one or both sides are covered with leather.
(2) Refers to instrumental music in general. Ancient drums were used to control other musical instruments. The ancients thought that the group sound was long, so it was called.
(3) Drums.
(4) Drum head.
(5) The place where Zhong Qing was struck.
(6) Drumming.
(7) Refers to drumming to make progress.
(8) Percussion or play (musical instrument).
(9) Vibration; shaking.
(10) Generally refers to knocking or pat.
(11) Waving; dancing.
(12) Use a wind box and other fans (wind).
(13) (The wind blows) to inflate.
(14) Protruding; swelling.
(15) Excite; cheer up.
(16) Incitement; incitement.
(17) Advocate, lift up.
(18) Musician who plays drums.
(19) The shape, function, and sound are like drums.
(20) Hair accessories covered in a bun.
(21) Ancient time unit. It is called because of drumming to tell the time.
(22) Names of ancient measuring instruments or weighing instruments. There are different opinions about its capacity or weight.
(23) Metering.
(24) In ancient times, ten pieces of cloth were called a drum.
(25) Ancient country names. In the Spring and Autumn Period, the Drum Country was a branch of Bai Di in the west of Jinxian County, Hebei Province.
